atomic.description: If set, installation process purges chart on fail (also sets wait flag)

caFile.description: Verify certificates of HTTPS-enabled servers using this CA bundle

certFile.description: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL certificate file

chart.description: A chart archive. This can be a chart reference, a path to a packaged chart, a path to an unpacked chart directory or a URL

chartVersion.description: Specify the exact chart version to install

commandLineValues.description: Set values on the command line. Can separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2

depUp.description: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart

devel.description: Use development versions, too (equivalent to version >0.0.0-0). If version is set, this is ignored

fileValues.description: Set values from respective files. Can separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2

inCluster.description: If true, the Helm connector will use a ServiceAccount to connect to the Kubernetes cluster. This is useful when StreamFlow runs directly inside a Kubernetes Pod

keepHistory.description: Remove all associated resources and mark the release as deleted, but retain the release history

keyFile.description: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL key file

keyring.description: Location of public keys used for verification

kubeContext.description: Name of the kubeconfig context to use

kubeconfig.description: Absolute path of the kubeconfig file to be used

maxConcurrentConnections.description: Maximum number of concurrent connections to open for a single Kubernetes client

namespace.description: Namespace to install the release into

nameTemplate.description: Specify template used to name the release

noHooks.description: Prevent hooks from running during install

password.description: Chart repository password where to locate the requested chart

registryConfig.description: Path to the registry config file

repositoryCache.description: Path to the file containing cached repository indexes

repositoryConfig.description: Path to the file containing repository names and URLs

releaseName.description: The release name. If unspecified, it will autogenerate one for you

renderSubchartNotes.description: Render subchart notes along with the parent

repo.description: Chart repository url where to locate the requested chart

locationsCacheTTL.description: Available locations cache TTL (in seconds). When such cache expires, the connector performs a new request to check locations availability

resourcesCacheTTL.description: (**Deprecated.** Use locationsCacheTTL.) Available resources cache TTL (in seconds). When such cache expires, the connector performs a new request to check resources availability

skipCrds.description: If set, no CRDs will be installed

stringValues.description: Set string values. Can separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2

timeout.description: Time to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation

transferBufferSize.description: Buffer size allocated for local and remote data transfers
transferBufferSize.$comment: Kubernetes Python client talks with its server counterpart, written in Golang, via Websocket protocol. The standard websocket package in Golang defines DefaultMaxPayloadBytes equal to 32 MB. Nevertheless, since kubernetes-client prepends channel number to the actual payload (which is always 0 for STDIN), we must reserve 1 byte for this purpose

username.description: Chart repository username where to locate the requested chart

yamlValues.description: Specify values in a list of YAML files and/or URLs

verify.description: Verify the package before installing it

wait.description: If set, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, Services, and minimum number of Pods of a Deployment are in a ready state before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as timeout
